[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The School Management System (SMS) defines requirements for managing courses, trainers, and documents.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: SMS supports course catalog, scheduling, registration, trainer assignment, and document storage.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: SMS integrates with school websites, email services, and document storage for automated updates, notifications, and secure file management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: SMS provides web dashboards using React.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: SMS supports web-based access on computing devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: SMS uses PostgreSQL, REST APIs, and scheduling systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: SMS secures data transmission via HTTPS.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: SMS optimizes storage for course and participant data.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: SMS links to document repositories and LMS.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: SMS manages courses, trainers, registrations, and documents.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: SMS is designed for administrators, trainers, and students.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: SMS requires internet; depends on email and document storage.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: SMS relies on OAuth authentication and cloud storage.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Course Catalog: List of courses, trainers, and schedules.
Referenced Document: Supporting material stored in document repositories.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall allow course catalog updates via API calls to school websites.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall send email invitations using SendGrid.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow administrators to manage courses and schedules (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall register participants and send confirmations (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall assign trainers and store session records.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an interactive dashboard (REQ-FUNC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall display course schedules, trainers, and participants.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process registrations without significant delay (REQ-FUNC-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall load course catalogs in under a couple seconds (REQ-FUNC-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store courses, registrations, trainer assignments, and session records (REQ-FUNC-001, REQ-FUNC-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall enforce role-based access control for administrators, trainers, and participants (REQ-DB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with GDPR and FERPA.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log all course updates and registrations.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Unit, integration, and load testing validate course management, registration, and trainer assignments.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API documentation, security policies.
[SEC] 5. References: GDPR, FERPA and Educational data privacy regulations.
